website_summaries.verdict: If Siri-powered color changes are all that you're after, then this might be the bulb for you.
pros: Sylvania's HomeKit-compatible color-changing bulb is easy to use and less expensive than Lifx
Unlike Philips Hue, it doesn't require you to plug a hub into your router
cons: Sylvania's Smart Plus bulbs rely entirely on Apple's Home app, where the lighting controls aren't as sophisticated as you'll get with the dedicated apps of Lifx or Hue

customer_reviews.title: You don't screw in this bulb, it screws you
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these bulbs. One stopped working. It just stays on all the time and it doesn't show up anymore on lightify. I tried to log on and lightify can't find my account anymore. They won't let me register again. Customer support is Non- existent. I don't see why I have to go through a whole bunch of registration and serial numbers for a light bulb. So how many engineers does is take to screw in a lightbulb? It doesn't matter, the lightbulb is screwing you
customer_reviews.author: Zygster

customer_reviews.title: Works well with a smartthings hub, can be used outdoors
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were a little confusing suggesting that you need a special hub (other than the smartthings hub I already have)... You don't... I was able to add it to smartthings by turning on the light and having the SmartThings app search for new devices. Easy installation, and you can control both the brightness (dimmable) and the color. The color part is really useful. You probably will not use any of the crazy colors on a day to day basis, but being able to chose the right color temperature of the light to match the surrounding really helps. I have it on my front porch (covered and inside and outdoor light fixture .
customer_reviews.author: U. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Beware - broken SmartThings integration
customer_reviews.text: The bulb itself, when it's working, looks nice, provides plenty of options to adjust light colour, intensity and temperature. I have it connected to a SmartThings (V2 hub) system, and it loses connection after a short while, power cycling the bulb restores connectivity for a while but breaks again after just a few hours. It's reported as offline in the SmartThings app, although I can still turn it on and off and make other changes, strangely. Voice control via an Echo device reports that the bulb isn't responding. It seems others have seen this issue as well. As a result, the bulb is worthless to me and I'll probably send it back as defective.
customer_reviews.author: Loki

customer_reviews.title: Perfect white output and temp control. Impressive color output. Lasted 6 months but replaced under warranty.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, we really liked this bulb and the flexibility. I got it for my wife to be able to tune to whatever color and temp works well when she has a migraine. Pretty impressively bright when in color mode (compared to others...I know we all want them to be as bright in color as they are when white but considering). The base can get pretty warm. Died after 6 months but it's being replaced my the manufacturer. The first replacement was the wrong kind (a non-color version) but I let them know and they're sending the right one.
customer_reviews.author: J. Isabelle

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.text: Sylvania will be terminating support for these bulb by August 2021, meaning that they'll be nothing more than EXTREMELY overpriced LED bulbs with no remote control abilities. I've spent the last several years changing my home over to these bulbs for the Alexa/internet integration, and within a year they'll be uselsess. Save your money. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Works beautifully with SmartThings and Google home hubs.
customer_reviews.text: Great value since they are not much more expensive than every day clf bulbs. I ordered two bulbs for my living room lamps and after setting them up I immediately realized the potential so I'm back today to order 4 more. I'm going to put two in my recessed lighting over my counters, one in my bedroom, and one for my porch light. I was worried about placing these bulbs outside but I found the spec sheet and it shows having an operating temperature between -4°F to +10°F (-20°C and +40°C) which is within my climate's temperatures so I should be safe.
customer_reviews.author: PhillyOC

customer_reviews.title: Works with smartthings perfectly, very nice color, can also tune color temp
customer_reviews.text: Bulb is instantly recognized by smartthings hub. Fairly easy to set up in a multi light lamp and then group them together through various scenes or you can change the color independently through the app. At current price these lights are amazing. I would pay the full price of almost 50 dollars but the 14 dollar sale price I got these at was a bargain. Especially for bulbs that you can also adjust color temp as well as the actual color, so it's not only RGBW but you can have soft white (2700K) or daylight (6500K) or anything in between.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Lorenzen

customer_reviews.title: Yes, bulb does fail af few months out -- do  not purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I have to agree with some earlier reviews (which I scoffed at, sorry). This bulb failed about six months after I purchased it. No, I did not abuse it. Yes, I do know what I'm doing. I've been a hardware/software tech for many decades. I will also mention that it does not create the truest colors -- I have some cheaper WiFi-controlled LED bulbs which have much better color than this one. I've yet to go google what are better bulbs in the Z-wave world. But surely they must exist.
customer_reviews.author: Rector Praetorius

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. Decent value
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these in the house and have been using this brand for 2-3 years, initially with Wink, and now with Smartthings. (I dumped Wink after they started demanding monthly subscriptions. The bulbs were easy to add to both Wink and Smartthings. They work great with Alexa, especially if you create a "group" of lights for a room so you can just tell Alexa to turn living room lights off, or set the living room lights to blue. Decent value for the money
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Horrible colors!  Washed out, weak.
customer_reviews.text: Colors are horrible! Weak, washed out, shallow. I have another brand I've used for Halloween and around the house for fun, the colors are rich, and vibrant. Thought I'd try these out since they don't need Wi-Fi, and I truly regret it! As I said, the colors are horrible, they are shallow, not deep and rich at all. Additionally, one out of two bulbs is bad! Reading the reviews, it seems like these have some serious reliability issues. Listen, I will leave a great product a great review, and average product and average review, but this is a horrible product so it's getting a horrible review.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Conners

customer_reviews.title: Nice bulbs, decent price - poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Really thought that these would be the answer for a nightlight, and they worked nicely for a while. Then, the lamp died - thinking that it was a fluke, I got another one. That one has now died at just past the two year mark - right after the warranty ended. These are the only smart bulbs that I've had that have failed this often - most of the bulbs I have are significantly older and work just fine... Must find a new manufacturer...
customer_reviews.author: Kristian Stark

customer_reviews.title: Good with Wink Hub 2!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bulb! I use it with my Wink Smart Home (Wink Hub 2) and it never falls offline. With a power outage, I literally just leave it alone and it always comes back online. The colors are nice, but wish the purple was stronger. Always looks like an off pink hue. But it is nice for changing the colors to match my D&D games!
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent
customer_reviews.text: I got two of these bulbs, and they almost always turn on to different colors no matter what I try. One of the bulbs flickers a lot, and is failing already (turns on very dim, loses connection). Thinking about using the warranty, not sure if I would buy this again. The “bad” bulb is in a brand new lamp, I even moved the network extender closer to rule out problems. Both bulbs are on bedstand lamps, so are only a few feet apart.
customer_reviews.author: Robert F Pannett

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: I had two of these. I say "had" because they have both stopped working. They both appear to have failed similarly, some broken connection inside. Sometimes if I poked them just right, they might work for a couple minutes. Even if they hadn't failed, operation of them through the SmartThings gateway was problematic and the color reproduction was terrible. I am saying all this as a comparison to a different brand of which I own a couple dozen and have worked infinitely better than these Sylvania bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Worked as advertised for 8 months then both failed within a couple weeks of one another
customer_reviews.text: I used mine with Smart things hub. Worked fine for about 8 months, on a fixed daily schedule of 2 hrs in the morning and abotu 4 hrs in the evening, both lights failed to work within a week of each other. One of them still technically works, but will only light up to about 10% no matter what setting I dial in. Will use another model going forward. I thought LED lights were supposed to last for several years.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic RGB bulb for the price
customer_reviews.text: The colors are certainly not as rich or as bright as the LifX bulbs, but I have no connectivity issues with my Wink 2 Hub and the colors are acceptable, especially since the price is far less than the other RGB bulbs and I have nothing but problems with the LifX bulb that I spent 3 times as much on. Would certainly recommend this bulb for the price.
customer_reviews.author: A.Texas.Yankee

customer_reviews.title: Barely lasted 7 months! Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of these bulbs on April of 2019. One of them gave me a lot of issues when pairing to my Smartthings hub. Sometimes, these bulbs won't respond to commands or take almost 5 seconds to comply. Now, after 7 months, one of my bulbs has died. It flickers and is stuck on the blue color. I can only turn it on or off. Changing colors causes it to flicker.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Would not recomend
customer_reviews.text: The color quality is horrible. Red is pink (at best) orange is, well kinda a dirty white, I'll just say colors are not vivid. They are cheaper, but the quality is not there. They were very easy to connect and have good reliability as far as working. Although a couple of them seem to change colors on their own from time to time, as well as brightness.
customer_reviews.author: BOOMOR

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this bulb and would one day like to have them all over the house. Alexa can turn it on and off easily (but can't change the colors). The app is great and works really well. The app has a lot of different settings and some schedules that can be programed in. A nice thing about this and the TP-Link switches is that you don't have to tell Alexa to open the skill first. Just say, "Alexa, tuned on the living room light." and it comes on. It's not 100%, won't work if the room is noisy but that's what the app is for.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Most options of any bulb
customer_reviews.text: Great bulbs with an endless number of settings via Smart Things hub. You can set to every possible color on the spectrum, every brightness between 0 and 100% and every temperature from very soft white to very bright white. I don't believe any other smart bulbs does this much. Alexa/Google Home can also do any of this via voice. Do not purchase the 2 pack option as I could not make them work with Smart Things or Alexa. Only negative is that they are extremely expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Font420

customer_reviews.title: At first they are wonderful, then they slowly become awful.
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs seem great at first. They connect to Smartthings very easily. After a couple of months I had one bulb fall apart. The dome just fell off without any assistance. At the same time that dome fell off the LEDs would get no brighter than "10%" Amazon did refund me for that particular issue. The remaining bulbs from that set plus the one that I purchased to replace it hum very loudly at any brightness, any color. This was a gradual issue. At first it was fine but now I can hear the bulbs from one room over. This is an awful product and a waste of a lot of money.
customer_reviews.author: kTosTIUGA

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This bulb is so neat. It works great with my WinkHub paired with Alexa. I can control it from my phone and change the light color to anything on the color wheel or spectrum from soft white to daylight. It was a perfect addition to our automated system in the house. I use this and others like it to appear home when we aren’t. The color changing is really fun even though I don’t NEED it. Will definely be adding a few more of these bulbs to our house soon.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, mediocre integration with ST.
customer_reviews.text: My hub of choice is smart things and these lights work ok, but not great. I knew going in that they weren't fully supported but the code and support out there seems glitchy at times. It will remember the color and brightness most of the time but sometimes the color is off and you have to do advanced programming to automate color or brightness in smart things because the existing device code for this simply creates a bulb that ST with turn on or off. It's a nice product but not prefect integration into ST.
customer_reviews.author: wishbone

customer_reviews.title: Compared to the P brand... For Price... Choose these!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATED... 3 months in and one bulb will not function properly. Its extremely dim ad resetting has not worked... their customer service is impossible to get in touh with, so until they get back to me this is the rating this deserves. Beautiful and work just as designed!!! Compared to the P brand that are 3x as expensive these work just as well!!!
customer_reviews.author: k3wl6uy

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2 and one broke in less than a month
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 and one broke in less than a month. It flickers and the color can not be accurately changed. I noticed it was flickering and thought maybe it was the fixture and moved it to a separate fixture. At that point I noticed it was incredibly hot for an LED bulb. Probably had something to do with it. I bought 2 and 1 failed. Thats a 50% failure rate. If this was a test, this bulb would get an F.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.M

customer_reviews.title: Great bulb when used with the Echo Plus
customer_reviews.text: So far I'm really loving this bulb. I put it in an old lamp and connected it to an Echo Plus. I can change colors or the brightness just by asking Alexa. Only one little peculiarity, the Alexa App shows a "cool white" setting, but trying to select it gives an error that the color is not available. Every other color works, except cool white. Weird.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Packrat

customer_reviews.title: Light was a dud
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box the light didn't work correctly. First time I plugged it in it turned on green. OK, no problem. I did a reset on the light. The next time it turned on blue. Did multiple resets and each time I was able to successfully pair with my smart hub but the problem was the light would never turn white no matter what I did. Apparently this one is a lemon so I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Rob_B

customer_reviews.title: They die to easy, horrib
customer_reviews.text: I guess you get what you pay for. Since they are zigbee that's great and they are kinda a descent price but I have had 2 die after only a few months......... Cannot get any customer support from Sylvania.
customer_reviews.author: jro2020

customer_reviews.title: The colors are not super accurate, but it is bright and relatively inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: I use with a Samsung SmartThings v2 HUB and I lose control of the light on occasion. I may be my hub, because I lose contact with other ZigBee devices as well - I never have a problem with Z-wave devices. The colors are not super accurate, but it is bright and relatively inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Bernardo D.

customer_reviews.title: Ordered 6 of these bulbs - So far 4 have  stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I tried to like these bulbs and they work very well, but for a short period of time (less than 1 year). I use them with Smartthings to have them change color to match the daylight temperature throughout the day. The color temperature of the different shades of white are very nice, but unfortunately 4 of the 6 I've purchased have stopped working. Their customer support has been helpful in sending replacement bulbs as they die out, but I fear it's going to be a never ending problem. If I had the time and money back I would have picked a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Brushett

customer_reviews.title: Really cool and wonderful colors.
customer_reviews.text: These lights are really cool, once you figure out how to work them. As with many of these products the instructions are poor but once you sit back and think about it the application and use make sense. I like the fact that the hub can go anywhere instead of being tied directly to your router. Lots of wonderful colors and features. I am ordering more.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Jansen

customer_reviews.title: USED, SOLD AS NEW - AVOID SCAM
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs arrive in what appears to be a factory sealed box, but are clearly used. They are dirty and do not match the product imaging on the box. The second one I bought was still paired with someone else’s system!
customer_reviews.author: Dan Parnell

customer_reviews.title: I just got one of these because I was looking to for a cheaper alternative to the hue bulbs
customer_reviews.text: I just got one of these because I was looking to for a cheaper alternative to the hue bulbs. Oh did these impress. Color reproduction is great, if not better than the hue bulbs I have. They are bright. I can't comment on their app because I paired these with my smart things hub which they did with no fuss. Smartthings picked them up and added them immediately. If you are in the market for colored bulbs take a look at these.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: February 18th to March 31st. Dead. Get out of the business Sylvania, and let the pros like LIFX and Philips make products worth purchasing. So ironic that March 20th was my “return by” date.
customer_reviews.author: Rufus

customer_reviews.title: Cool light to a connected setup
customer_reviews.text: I really like this light bulb. I'm able to control the colors and brightness using the app. I will be connecting this to my samsung smartthings and eventually connect this with my echo for voice commands. the light bulb is used on the top ceiling looking over my new jacuzzi tub. I definitely can see us using the many colors for different moods.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Broke in less than a month
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, but these broke in less than a month. Contacted Sylvania's customer support and they have been extremely unhelpful.
customer_reviews.author: A. Salkeld

customer_reviews.title: Garbage, not worth purchasing!
customer_reviews.text: This bulb only lasted a few months and now it goes dim and flickers randomly. It will drop to like 5% brightness and stay there for awhile. I would not recommend at all.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Goulding

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t buy them again.
customer_reviews.text: These lights are not worth the money I paid for them. One shipped broke out of the box and the other died after 5 months of use. I have one left that’s working and it constantly disconnects from my Samsung SmartThings hub
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Valencia

customer_reviews.title: Works but..
customer_reviews.text: Works with alexa. My gen two echo with built in hub recognized the bulb quickly and I can fully control it via alexa Bulb could be a bit brighter however as compared to my hue bulbs. Overall 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Merf

customer_reviews.title: 4.5 stars.  Works as described, but IOS app could use a little more development
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. The iPhone app could use a little further development (e.g. make it intuitive to quickly return to 2700K [warm white] after playing with the colors). And, as someone who is just starting to dabble in home automation, I would like to see Sylvania provide on-premises control of the lamps through an API that does not rely on Internet connectivity. 4.5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Native app control great; ST integration not so great
customer_reviews.text: The light bulb itself works great. However, the SmartThings native integration is very sub-par. Within ST you can control the light and change colors but setting presets was not available. The app appeared to show the capability to do so, but I could not get it to work. Removed the device from ST and utilized the native Lightify app. Control and settings are much more granular and my son is having fun with the light now.
customer_reviews.author: jalcala

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctioning / Dead Within Four Months
customer_reviews.text: Half the bulbs malfunctioned within a few months of use. Malfunctioning bulbs became extremely dim, pale blue and stopped responding to commands. Resetting them didn't work. See photo. Bulb on left has malfunctioned. Bulb on right is working properly. Terrible quality. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: jykgkg

customer_reviews.title: doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: LED supposedly are long lasting, but not this one. I have two and both failed after a few months. Terrible strobe effect when switching on, random colors instead of white and the worst thing - few times it turned on by itself. Not fun when it happens in the bedroom in the middle of the night. For the price I paid terrible deal from sylvania.
customer_reviews.author: Greg P

customer_reviews.title: Works with Echo and Smartthings
customer_reviews.text: I have both a Smartthings hub and Amazon Echo. This light paired with quickly and simply, and is easily and controlled with both apps. With Smartthings, I can completely control the brightness and thousands of colors. With Alexa, I can control the brightness and some pre-programmed colors. This light is fantastic. My only complaint is that the color washes out a bit as the brightness increases. If you want deep colors, the brightness must be kept lower.
customer_reviews.author: P. Aronnax

customer_reviews.title: Love it, but beware.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product for my husband. He linked it to our Amazon Echo, and it has been too much temptation for one man. Turns on and off the light on me, and the changing of the color. So this product works and works well.
customer_reviews.author: cvelarde80

customer_reviews.title: Works well after a firmware update
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but I had to purchase the Lightify gateway just to be able to update the firmware since the bulbs where coming on by themselves before the update. I normally use them with a 3rd party hub so the gateway was only needed for about 15 minutes, just long enough to connect the bulbs to it and update the firmware.
customer_reviews.author: TroyTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed with the reliability of this bulb
customer_reviews.text: Product was working well, but started flickering after a month and a few days after that was completely unresponsive. Very disappointed with the reliability of this bulb.
customer_reviews.author: John Zapata

customer_reviews.title: Great value great features but with an odd behavior
customer_reviews.text: Quit responding good color reproduction parentheses a little week on the blues). I love them for the price and features. However, they seem to want to default in about 20% when they transition from off to on even though the last state was 100%. If they could fix this with the firmware update they would be awesome
customer_reviews.author: Armand

customer_reviews.title: They only last a year.....
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 3 of these. After about a little over a year the brightness dropped to about 25% on 2 of them and they would randomly flicker back to 100%. It didn’t matter what color they were on, even trying to adjust in smart things no matter what level you set brightness to they would not get bright.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice when it worked.
customer_reviews.text: The bulb was great while it lasted. One day it stopped working and was to hot to touch, never worked after that.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother.
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for almost a year at this point. They have been nothing but a problem the entire time. They were a pain to sync, and constantly lose communication with my smart hub and need reset. Save yourself the trouble and get Phillips hue lights.
customer_reviews.author: Moderate techie

customer_reviews.title: Great, work as expected. Colors not quite as vibrant as I thought.
customer_reviews.text: These work well with my smartthings controller. Using 2 of them for my front porch light. Have created a schedule to change colors for various holidays, special occasions etc. Would recommend as an inexpensive way to play around with color changing bulbs. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Eric H.

customer_reviews.title: Requires Hub
customer_reviews.text: Good customer service, not very clearly labelled as REQUIRING A HUB. So, beautiful colors if you're already using a smart things hub, otherwise, avoid this in favor of something that is already a WIFI bulb that works with alexa.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Andrew Becking

customer_reviews.title: Poor color range
customer_reviews.text: It's only half price of hue but you get what you paid for. The color richness is nowhere close. It was easy to pair with smart things hub, but no matter what you do, you cannot get a purple color. Not even a purplish color. Retuned.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: These lights are amazing. I had a set of two that I ...
customer_reviews.text: These lights are amazing. I had a set of two that I originally purchased a year ago and they have surpassed my expectation. So I bought another set. Once again they have done an magnificent job. I live in Washington with weather ranging from -17 to 100+ Fahrenheit. I use these bulb out on my back porch, my front yard as well as my little boys room (which they absolutely love!) These bulbs tie into my home automation perfectly, I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: radiantblonde

customer_reviews.title: Samsung Smarthings and Alexa Compatible
customer_reviews.text: Works great with Samsung Smarthings Hub and Alexa, Setup couldn't be easier. Turn it on, start a search from Smarthings. One note, after a power failure the light will turn on white. You will have to recycle it by sending a command to it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S. Herda

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a few months
customer_reviews.text: We enjoyed this bulb and playing with different colors for about half a year and then it started flickering. We tried moving it to other lamp bases but the problem was the bulb. After the flickering it started randomly changing colors. Then it stopped altogether. Supposed to last a lifetime...I guess the lifetime of a fly.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Welty

customer_reviews.title: These are SO FUN. I really don't use them for the color ...
customer_reviews.text: These are SO FUN. I really don't use them for the color function, so I'll buy the normal ones that can be adjusted warm/cool next time, but the colors will be fun for parties. Great quality, and I pair with a Wink hub and Amazon Echo.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Works great and works with Alexa but not as bright or smooth in color transitions as other models.
customer_reviews.text: PRO: Beautiful color. Reasonably smooth transitions to different colors. Works with Alexa. Energy saving. NEG: Not as smooth in color transitions as more expensive options. Not exceptionally bright.
customer_reviews.author: Nobody777

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's advertised to do
customer_reviews.text: First off, I don't give 5 stars unless a product is extraordinary. This bulb does everything it is advertised to do. I use it with a SmartThings hub and the setup was easy. To achieve a special color other than the standard RGBW takes some trial and error, but it is definitely doable. I would buy this bulb again and recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: BVBob

customer_reviews.title: Useful for home automation
customer_reviews.text: I use this with a SmartThings hubv2 as a visual notification when things happen around the home. Blue for a water sensor, green for the garage door, red for CO/smoke alarm, and dimmed warm white with a motion sensor at night.
customer_reviews.author: ByteTime

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy it!
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t connect to the wifi. I tried for hours and it can’t find the lamp. Turned the lamp on and off, thought the problem was with the WiFi, turn on and off, and nothing happened. Asked someone else to try to make it work, still NOTHING. All it did was be a regular lamp. So frustrating!!! Not worth it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Natasha

customer_reviews.title: Works with SmartThings seamlessly
customer_reviews.text: Works great with SmartThings. Does not require another hub - it works with my Samsung v2 hub. I like the ability to tell Google Home to change the color of the light.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Guelker

customer_reviews.title: Color Lights.
customer_reviews.text: Color works great once you have the hubs in place. So if you don't have a hub, you will need one. If you have it, make sure it's the right one. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Russ G.

customer_reviews.title: Going to get another one
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic! Easy to integrate with smartthings. I have 2. For the holidays, i set one to be green and one red. Continued my normal lighting schedule, but each night they came on in the festive colors that i'd preset.
customer_reviews.author: Casual shopper

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably priced for w
customer_reviews.text: The lamps were packaged very well and easy to connect w/ Samsung SmartThings, easy to program, and surprisingly functional. What a feature filled, economical, and fun device!!
customer_reviews.author: Randy Hirose

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable and short life-span.
customer_reviews.text: works only 25% of the time, and very unreliable. Have already had to order warranty exchanges twice in less than a year.
customer_reviews.author: G. Coley

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this
customer_reviews.text: I am replacing all my smart lights with these lights because they work much better & they work with my hub in my echo.
customer_reviews.author: MR. & MR. Neff

customer_reviews.title: The colors arent very accurate. It also doesnt seem ...
customer_reviews.text: The colors arent very accurate. It also doesnt seem very bright to me. Overall the system is ok, but if i had to do it all over again I would spend a little more on the tp link bulbs that dont need a hub.
customer_reviews.author: danlunatic

customer_reviews.title: Would not connect to smartihings or alexa
customer_reviews.text: I've bought these bulbs before and they usually blink a couple of times to let you know they are in pairing mode and this bulb did not do that. I would like to return it and get my money back
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: This bulb gets EXTREMELY hot for an LED other than ...
customer_reviews.text: This bulb gets EXTREMELY hot for an LED other than that it works as it should (when the zigbee network is working that is).
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: it worked well for 6 months then started flickering and then stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: C. Munns

customer_reviews.title: Item being shipped is "Lightify", not "Smart+"
customer_reviews.text: This item is advertised as the Sylvania "Smart+" light bulb. Instead, I received the Sylvania "Lightify" light bulb. "Lightify" is the old version of the light bulb and "Smart+" is the new version of the light bulb. "Smart+" light bulbs can be used directly with an Apple HomeKit hub (eg. AppleTV or iPad), "Lightify" light bulbs cannot and require a non-HomeKit hub. Sylvania states this in their description of the Smart+ product on their official website. Amazon will not let me leave a review without also leaving a rating. Once I receive the correct product I will revise this rating.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: An Absolute Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: Works great.... for about 3 months. The return window is closed. I should have just thrown my money in the trash. It would have been easier.
customer_reviews.author: James D. Hackney

customer_reviews.title: I like the different colors
customer_reviews.text: I like the different colors, but needing the gateway makes it less worthwhile. It also would not stay connected after a while when the phone/app locks.
customer_reviews.author: HW

customer_reviews.title: Random on/off
customer_reviews.text: Lights randomly turn on/off with no interaction from the hub, switches, etc. It's really disturbing to have your lights come on full power at 2am. I will never by any Sylvania/Osram "smart" bulbs again... way too dumb.
customer_reviews.author: bear454

customer_reviews.title: I added four of these lights to my wink hub ...
customer_reviews.text: I added four of these lights to my wink hub for Christmas effects and I have found them to be reliably and quite effortless to use in the wink world with Alexa commands. Would give a five star except color depth seams lacking for some colors.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl B. Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice to choose color.Did not work with Osram Lightify hub so I bought Samsung smart hub.
customer_reviews.author: Lester O.

customer_reviews.title: ... then for a few years now and they worked great at first
customer_reviews.text: I have had then for a few years now and they worked great at first. Now they are having issues. go on and off all the time. sad I can not do anything because they are no longer under warren-tee!!
customer_reviews.author: Eric A Mion

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but very functional
customer_reviews.text: Expensive light but very nice. Used for my kids night light. The colors and being dimmable are awesome. The best thing is that no HUB is needed to work with Wink HUB unlike the Phillips lights.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Last!
customer_reviews.text: Loved these bulbs when I first got them. They worked well with my Alexa and they were easy to set up. I bought them in December of 2017 it is April of 2018 and these Bulbs no longer work anymore. The brightness has gone way down now on every color. I'd recommend staying away from this and saving your money if you can and go to Philips. As you can see in this photo this is brightness all the way up and my room is dark.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 8 month's
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 bulbs and the first one is now dead after 8 month's, I will not but again if I can only get 8 months out of a 45 dollar light bulb. It was nice wile it lasted
customer_reviews.author: Donald Rauch Jr

customer_reviews.title: I'm using this with Samsung Smartthings. Alexa can control ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this with Samsung Smartthings. Alexa can control it. I can control the color with my iPhone (although my wife gets upset when I set it to anything other than "white").
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Good but breaks.
customer_reviews.text: Nice, while it worked.. broke after 3 months of light use.. I think the problem is that it gets too hot and now the light flickers, on low.. I also had a lityle trouble connecting it to the hub.. 40$ wasted
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: but the colors seem good to me
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be easier to sync with wink. Don't know how it compares to the hue, but the colors seem good to me. At a cheaper price. Wouldn't use as main lighting because there not the brightest. More of a mood setting light.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I haven't got to use it yet except for a ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't got to use it yet except for a light bulb,keep on buying things to make it work but apparently I keep getting the wrong things .

customer_reviews.title: Stops working
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after a couple months. Second bulb that did this. Don’t buy!!!!

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It works great with Alexa and SmartThings easy to pair

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Colors
customer_reviews.text: It's like buying the box of 4 crayons when you can get a 64 box. Just don't waste your money. Spend a little more and get a bulb you'll be happy with. This isn't it.

customer_reviews.title: Out of order, Not satisfactory.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product 3 months ago and today I opened the box and installed. One of 2 bulbs is out of order. The normal one works OK but this bulb can not memorize the last status(brightness) when you turn off the switch.

customer_reviews.title: This was a pain to set up, and it ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a pain to set up, and it still isn't fully functional - I can't control it as much as I want.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 10 of these less than two years ago and 3 have gone bad so far. Can't recommend a $30 light bulb that needs replaced this often. Just about to try some Philips hue, hope they last longer.

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Fully under SmartThings control.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. My Samsung SmartThings paired quickly and my Android can now control it from anywhere there is an Internet connection.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy.
customer_reviews.text: Works with my Google Home, you just gotta get the phone app called "IFTTT" and do some setting up but once you do it, it works perfectly. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Cole Jezowski

customer_reviews.title: I have purchased several of these and they work well ...
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several of these and they work well with home automation. Having them outdoors, especially for Halloween and Christmas upcoming - we were able to add some color accents to the outside of our home saving us a lot of time with decorating. My wife loves them.

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Smartthings hub
customer_reviews.text: Pairs with smartthings hub without issue. Good color control via the smartthings app. Great color spectrum.

customer_reviews.text: I have 5 of these color bulbs and a lot of the white ones. All work great via Smarthings and Alexa.

product_meta.title: SYLVANIA SMART+ ZigBee Bulb, Color Changing, Works with SmartThings, Wink, and Amazon Echo Plus, Hub needed for Amazon Alexa and the Google Assistant
product_meta.description: Size:1 Pack| Color:Full ColorSylvania LED lamp, series: lighting, dimmable, LED9.5/a19/dim/great brittan W/lfy designation, 10 W, 120 V, a19 bulb, medium screw E26 base, arbitrary shape, 800 lumens, 20000 hr. Average life, 80+, 1900 6500 K color temperature, 2.36 in diameter, 4.33 in length, standards: UL listed, rohs complaint, fc, ziggurat brittany eye, for residential, small business and hospitality. product details smart home: ZigBee, SmartThings, wink, Amazon echo plus voice control: Alexa, Google assistant shape: Edison screw a19 light color: soft white, warm white, bright white, cool white, daylight color temperature: 2700 Kelvin 6500 kelvin functionality: dimming, changes color (RGB) and adjustable white power consumption: 10 watt equivalent bulb: 60W incandescent> light brightness: 800 lumen average life span: 10000 h (10 years).
feature_bullets: ZigBee Light Bulb: Whether you forgot to turn a light off or want to turn your lights on before you come home from work, you can monitor your lights right from your smartphone and create schedules and automations to fit your daily routines

Smart Home Lighting: Integrate voice control by pairing an Amazon Echo or Google Home device to your compatible ZigBee hub Enjoy the benefits of hands free lighting control by asking to turn the lights on and off, dim, change the color and more
Hub required for set up: A compatible ZigBee hub is required to control this light bulb Pair your smart bulb to a compatible ZigBee hub such as SmartThings, Wink, or Amazon Echo Plus
